snippet: Family members who observed resuscitation efforts were significantly less likely to experience symptoms of post-traumatic stress, anxiety and depression than family members who did not.
abstract: Study published in New England Journal of Medicine finds that family members who observed resuscitation efforts were significantly less likely to experience symptoms of post-traumatic stress, anxiety and depression than family members who did not.
lead_paragraph: Family members who observed resuscitation efforts were significantly less likely to experience symptoms of post-traumatic stress, anxiety and depression than family members who did not.

headline.seo: Study Finds Benefits From Observing CPR
headline.main: Families May Gain From Observing CPR
headline.print_headline: Families May Gain From Observing CPR
